bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 169, Number 205 (Wednesday, December 13, 2023)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. GALLEGO:H.R. 6752.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 18The single subject of this legislation is:Foreign Affairs[Page H6942]

item.title: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2024

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

summary.text: This bill requires the President to transmit a report to Congress within 48 hours after any incident in which the Armed Forces are involved in an attack or hostilities, except in certain circumstances as provided under the War Powers Resolution. The report must contain specified elements, including the authority or authorities under which the Armed Forces were operating when the incident occurred.

bill.title: To require prompt reporting of any incident in which the Armed Forces are involved in an attack or hostilities, and for other purposes.

item.title: To require prompt reporting of any incident in which the Armed Forces are involved in an attack or hostilities, and for other purposes.
To require prompt reporting of any incident in which the Armed Forces are involved in an attack or hostilities, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Foreign Affairs.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
